introduction.para: Typing in Excel for iPad can be tricky at first, especially if you’re used to a physical keyboard. This training video shows you some typing tips for Excel for iPad. It covers typing text, numbers and formulas.

section.title: Other tutorial videos for Excel for iPad:

listItem.para: Open files from the cloud. Open files from OneDrive for Business (for your work or school stuff), OneDrive.com (for your personal stuff), or from a Dropbox account.
Open email attachments. Open, edit, and send back email attachments using Excel for iPad.

How saving works in Excel for iPad. Excel for iPad automatically saves your work every time you make even a small change. In most cases, you don’t have to do anything at all to save your document. Watch this training video to learn about AutoSave.

Type in Excel for iPad. (You are here!) Typing in Excel for iPad can be tricky at first, especially if you’re used to a physical keyboard. This training video shows you some typing tips for Excel for iPad. It covers typing text, numbers and formulas.
Select stuff in Excel for iPad. Select cells, ranges, columns, and rows expertly with your finger in Excel for iPad. This training video helps you move from the mouse to the touchscreen.
How to print in Excel for iPad. You tap the File button to print in Excel for iPad. Watch this video to learn how. At this time, you can only print to an AirPrint compatible printer.
